{"rule":"VERB_NOUN_CONFUSION","sentence":"^\\QBy considering three-note combinations (3HE) instead of dyads, which is done by populating the search space with 2-dimensional points representing the 2 intervals between the 3 notes (as opposed to searching through points on the real line up to some Weil/Tenney height or Farey sequence iteration), this model is able to break the negative-harmony \"curse\" of using purely dyadic heights.\\E$"}
